intro: Belloa eriophora, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, and purple, typically blooming in the spring and summer. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to thrive in arid and sandy environments. Belloa eriophora is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
